conversion_verification.notes: 3D render shows extruded walls with thickness, visible top faces, and a roof/ceiling cutaway exposing interior spaces from an elevated angled view (slightly near top-down but not purely orthographic).

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have consistent height/thickness and readable corner geometry; clear cutaway. View is slightly close to top-down which reduces perceived verticality/perspective depth a bit.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout matches (dining left, kitchen top-center, living right, bedroom bottom-left, bath core center, stairs bottom-right). Some proportional/partition nuances and exact opening (door/window) placements are not perfectly verifiable/matched from the render.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present and correctly assigned to rooms (dining set, living seating, bed; kitchen cabinetry; bathroom fixtures). Scale/orientation generally coherent.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation with clear differentiation of walls/floors/furniture; interior is visible. Slightly flat lighting and near-top-down camera reduce spatial readability marginally.

detected_errors.description: Door/window positions and opening dimensions do not appear fully consistent or are not clearly represented compared with the 2D plan.
Minor proportional/layout deviations in some partitions/room extents (especially around the central wash/toilet core and entry/living transition) relative to the 2D plan.

summary: A true 3D cutaway model is produced with strong overall layout fidelity, with only minor-to-moderate deviations in proportions and opening placements from the 2D plan.
